meanings.definition: Unable to be touched or grasped physically.
meanings.sent1: The intangibility of the ghostly figure left the scientist puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The concept of love is often described as having an intangibility that makes it hard to understand.
meanings.sent3: The intangibility of the invisible cloak made for a comical situation at the magic show.
meanings.sent4: The intangibility of time slipping through our fingers is a constant reminder of its fleeting nature.
meanings.sent5: The intangibility of the dream left a lingering sense of mystery in the air.

meanings.definition: Quality of being abstract or not easily defined.
meanings.sent1: The intangibility of the idea made it difficult to explain to the class.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers often ponder the intangibility of truth and reality.
meanings.sent3: The intangibility of happiness seemed to dance just out of reach.
meanings.sent4: The intangibility of success can sometimes be more motivating than its concrete rewards.
meanings.sent5: The intangibility of the concept sparked a lively debate among the students.
